commentary: Ellis to Ravi Bishnoi, 1 run, OUTBanged in short he pulls to deep backward square leg. Goes for a second, and is run out by miles.Ravi Bishnoi run out (Philippe/†Wade) 2 (2b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 100
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Ravi Bishnoi, out Ravi Bishnoi Run Out!! 1 run completed. A back of the hand slower ball again outside off, Ravi Bishnoi mistimes the pull to deep square leg and wants two. Philippe is quick and throws it on the bounce to Wade who does the rest. Bishnoi is nowhere near to making it back. Ravi Bishnoi run out (Philippe/Wade) 2(2)

commentary: Ellis to Arshdeep Singh, 1 byeSlower back of a length ball outside off, he has a wild swing and a miss. Bishnoi scampers through for a bye as Wade decides to not throw the ball
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Arshdeep Singh, byes, 1 run, a slower ball full outside off, Arshdeep Singh swings and misses, and they sneak a bye as Wade misses. Interesting with a direct-hit

commentary: Ellis to Arshdeep Singh,  2 runsBack of a length ball on leg stump, he helps it away to deep midwicket and they take two. Ellis seems to have hurt his ankle. He fell down on his follow-through and seems to be in a lot of pain. Out comes the physio.
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Arshdeep Singh, 2 runs, back of a length on the stumps, Arshdeep Singh mistimes the pull in front of deep mid-wicket and that allows the batters to come back for two. Nathan Ellis fell over after delivering that

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, OUTCleans him up with a corker of a yorker. Almost 140kph and bang on middle stump. Iyer looks to flay it away again, is hit on the boot with the ball then smashing into off pole. Fifty and out is Iyer.Shreyas Iyer b Ellis 53 (37b 5x4 2x6 69m) SR: 143.24
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, out Bowled!! Nathan Ellis comes back well. The yorker on the stumps, tailed in to middle-stump and through Shreyas Iyer's swing to leg. Cross-seam as well, catches the pad and falls on the stumps. Shreyas Iyer b Nathan Ellis 53(37) [4s-5 6s-2]

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, OUTCleans him up with a corker of a yorker. Almost 140kph and bang on middle stump. Iyer looks to flay it away again, is hit on the boot with the ball then smashing into off pole. Fifty and out is Iyer.Shreyas Iyer b Ellis 53 (37b 5x4 2x6 69m) SR: 143.24
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, wide, now the attempted off-cutter slower ball is wide of the tramline outside off, wide called

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 wideFuller and outside off, he shoulders arms and this time gets a wide
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, out Bowled!! Nathan Ellis comes back well. The yorker on the stumps, tailed in to middle-stump and through Shreyas Iyer's swing to leg. Cross-seam as well, catches the pad and falls on the stumps. Shreyas Iyer b Nathan Ellis 53(37) [4s-5 6s-2]

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 wideFuller and outside off, he shoulders arms and this time gets a wide
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, wide, now the attempted off-cutter slower ball is wide of the tramline outside off, wide called

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer,  SIX runsBANG!  Iyer gets his eighth T20I fifty in style. Another back of a hand slower ball outside off. He picks it early and deposits him over deep midwicket.See all photos
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, 50 for Shreyas Iyer! Another back of the hand slower ball and it's on a length just outside off, Shreyas Iyer gets forward and heaves it over deep mid-wicket, short boundary and easily cleared

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR runsSlower 111kph good length ball but the line was on leg stump. He gets inside the line and helps it to the right of deep backward square leg
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Shreyas Iyer starts the final over well. Picks the back of the hand slower ball on a length on the stumps and waits for it to swing it to deep backward square leg, beating the dive of the fielder

commentary: Behrendorff to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runFuller on middle and leg, whisked to deep midwicket
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, full on the stumps, clipped to deep mid-wicket and Shreyas Iyer retains the strike with that run

commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi,  1 runOoh aggression from Bishnoi. Was the pacy good length ball on off, he whacks it to deep midwicket
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ravi Bishnoi, 1 run, length just outside off, Ravi Bishnoi shuffles across and heaves to deep mid-wicket

commentary: Behrendorff to Axar Patel, OUTTop-edge and Hardie takes a smart catch running back from short third. Knuckle ball that was on a length on leg stump and arrives very late. Axar is through his flick way too early, and can only get a top-edge that is snapped up well. It actually went off the back of his bat to Hardie.Axar Patel c Hardie b Behrendorff 31 (21b 2x4 1x6 22m) SR: 147.61
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Axar, out Caught by Hardie at short third man!! The slower ball, knucke-ball, drifting down leg, hittable ball but Axar is early into the swing to leg, gets a top-edge and short third man runs back to take it. End of a superb knock. Axar c Hardie b Behrendorff 31(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

commentary: Behrendorff to Axar Patel,  2 runsFull-length ball outside off, he slices it over extra cover for a brace
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Axar, 2 runs, full and seam-up on the stumps, Axar gets forward to loft and slices it over extra-cover, a couple taken

commentary: Behrendorff to Axar Patel,  SIX runsGoing, going, gone! Back of a length ball outside off. Axar stands tall and slams him over long-on. He does not get a decent connection, but enough to clear the fielder
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Axar, SIX, Axar goes big. Picks the slower short ball and gets forward to flat-bat over long-on, sails away over the fielder

commentary: Behrendorff to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runSlower back of a length ball outside off, Iyer can only mow it to wide long on
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower ball on a length outside off, Shreyas Iyer gets forward and pulls to deep mid-wicket

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runFuller and outside off, he drives it nice and hard but can't beat extra cover
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, seam-up and full outside off, Shreyas Iyer drives well but can't beat extra-cover, just the single

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel,  1 runGood change of pace on that length ball outside off, he miscues to extra cover for a run
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, 1 run, another slower ball, the back of the hand slower ball this time, fullish outside off, Axar drives in front of extra-cover for one

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel, FOUR runs Banged in short and he flat-bats it soaring over extra cover. The field was in on the off side so these were easy pickings. He dances down and with mid-off and cover up sends it over the two.
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, FOUR, good hit. Nearly six too. Axar comes down the track and takes the slower short ball, flat-bats it over extra-cover and it's one bounce over the ropes

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel,  2 runsBack of a length ball outside off, he punches it to long on
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, 2 runs, short of length just outside off, Axar heaves to long-on and David takes it easy, they spot that and come back for a second

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel, no runLength on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, no run, short of length and tucks up Axar who punches it back

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel,  2 runsBack of a length ball just outside off, he whips it nicely in the gap between long on and deep midwicket. But McDermott sprints across from deep midwicket and keeps it down to two.
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, 2 runs, back of a length on off, Axar short-arm jabs wide of deep mid-wicket and McDermott gets across and cuts it off with a dive, saves two

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, no runSlower full ball well outside off again. Iyer shoulders arms looking for another wide, but the ball was just inside the tramline. Iyer is livid with that call
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, no run, Dwarshuis shifts to round the wicket. It's a slower ball full outside off, just inside the tramline, left alone and the ump deems it a legal ball

commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar Patel,  1 runOn a length on middle and leg, he whisks it away to deep square leg
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar, 1 run, full and shapes back in to off, Axar drives off a thick inside-edge to deep square leg

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runFull-length ball on pace this time outside off, driven to extra cover. The top hand comes off his bat handle as he plays the shot
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, full on off, Shreyas Iyer gets forward to drive with the bottom-hand off, dribbles to extra-cover

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runFull-length ball on pace this time outside off, driven to extra cover. The top hand comes off his bat handle as he plays the shot
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, wide, the slower ball is well wide outside off and Shreyas Iyer lets it go to take a wide

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 wideLength ball angling away from Iyer who shoulders arms. Called a wide.
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, full on off, Shreyas Iyer gets forward to drive with the bottom-hand off, dribbles to extra-cover

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 wideLength ball angling away from Iyer who shoulders arms. Called a wide.
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, wide, the slower ball is well wide outside off and Shreyas Iyer lets it go to take a wide

commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar Patel,  1 runPacy good length ball on his hips, he works it to deep fine leg
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Axar, 1 run, back of a length and angling into middle and leg, helped down to fine-leg

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runSlower ball as Iyer goes for a big shot again. The ball does not carry to long on. Was fuller and outside off. Iyer was way too early on the shot
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower ball full around off, Shreyas Iyer gets forward to loft and miscues it, well in front of long-on

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR runsBack of a length ball outside off, he stands tall and eases it past point. All timing and placement on that from Iyer
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, top shot. A short of length delivery angling away from Shreyas Iyer and he punches it through backward point, timing was great and no chance for sweeper cover who was not far away

commentary: T Sangha to Axar Patel, no runWild swing and a miss. Was floated outside off, Axar tries to go up and over the off side. Loses his balance and his footing.
second_commentary: Sangha to Axar, no run, tossed up full outside off, Axar gets forward to loft and misses, loses his balance and falls flat on his backside

commentary: T Sangha to Axar Patel,  2 runsShort again, on middle stump, he stays back and whacks it to the left of deep midwicket
second_commentary: Sangha to Axar, 2 runs, another couple. This legbreak turns in to middle-stump, Axar goes on the back foot and pulls to the left of deep mid-wicket for two

commentary: T Sangha to Axar Patel,  2 runsShort on middle stump, he hacks it in the gap between midwicket and deep square leg.
second_commentary: Sangha to Axar, 2 runs, fraction short outside off, Axar pulls between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket and they come back for a couple

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runAgain he finds some turn. Was floated outside off, the ball drifts across him. He pushes it uppishly but there is no fielders inside the circle on the off side
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower legbreak outside off, Shreyas Iyer gets forward to drive and hits it in the air but well wide of extra-cover

commentary: T Sangha to Axar Patel,  1 runAgain a touch quicker and outside off, he punches to long off
second_commentary: Sangha to Axar, 1 run, flat good length outside off, Axar goes on the back foot to punch to long-off

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runQuicker on off stump, he pushes towards long on
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, very full on the stumps, Shreyas Iyer gets forward to push to long-on

commentary: Behrendorff to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runSlower length ball just outside off, dabbed towards point
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower good length on off, tapped to the right of Wade for an easy single

commentary: Behrendorff to Axar Patel,  1 runBanged in short just outside off, Axar pulls and does well to keep it down to deep midwicket
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Axar, 1 run, slower short ball outside off, Axar pulls to deep mid-wicket

commentary: Behrendorff to Axar Patel, FOUR runsLovely shot. Was on a length outside off, Axar goes back and across and slices it over backward point. Finds the placement to his credit too
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Axar, FOUR, good shot. Length delivery outside off, Axar uses the width and carves it up and over backward point, no chance for sweeper cover

commentary: Behrendorff to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runSlower back of a length ball well outside off. Iyer completely mistimes his hack just past the bowler.
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter well wide outside off, Shreyas Iyer mistimes the cut and gets it past the outstretched left hand of Behrendorff, on the bounce though

commentary: Behrendorff to Axar Patel,  1 runGood length ball outside off, he cuts it past point for a run
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Axar, 1 run, good length outside off, Axar cuts to sweeper cover

commentary: Behrendorff to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runLength but on the pads to start off, he clips it to short fine leg and takes off for a run. Axar responds.
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, back of a length on the stumps, glanced to short fine-leg

commentary: Hardie to Axar Patel, no runKeeps it wicket to wicket, Axar pushes towards extra cover
second_commentary: Hardie to Axar, no run, good length and nips back in to off, Axar gets forward to push to cover

commentary: Hardie to Axar Patel, no runLength ball angling away from Axar, he opens the face of the bat to point
second_commentary: Hardie to Axar, no run, Hardie now round the wicket. Length delivery outside off, pushed to backward point

commentary: Hardie to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runKeeps it on a length on middle and leg, works it to deep midwicket
second_commentary: Hardie to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fullish on middle and leg, Shreyas Iyer flicks through mid-wicket for one

commentary: Hardie to Axar Patel,  1 runLength ball on the pads, clipped away to deep backward square leg for a run
second_commentary: Hardie to Axar, 1 run, back of a length on leg-stump again, nudged to deep backward square leg and Axar is off the mark

commentary: Hardie to Axar Patel, no runLength on middle and leg, ticked to the on side
second_commentary: Hardie to Axar, no run, back of a length on leg-stump, turned to mid-wicket

commentary: Hardie to Sharma, OUTNo timing at all and deep midwicket comes in to take a good catch. Hardie goes into the surface and aiming for Jitesh's body. He goes for a pull, but wasn't in position. Mistimes it altogether and Short completes the take low to his left.Jitesh Sharma c Short b Hardie 24 (16b 3x4 1x6 15m) SR: 150
second_commentary: Hardie to Jitesh Sharma, out Caught by Matthew Short!! Jitesh Sharma holes out and India slip into further trouble. A short of length delivery on off, Jitesh Sharma gets forward to pull and does not get hold of it, deep mid-wicket who is Short sinks low and catches it well. End of a little cameo. Jitesh Sharma c Matthew Short b Hardie 24(16) [4s-3 6s-1]

commentary: Ellis to Sharma,  1 runFuller on middle stump, he pushes to mid-off and hares down for a run. Would have been interesting with a direct hit, Behrendorff misses though
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, full on the stumps, Jitesh Sharma drives to the left of mid-off and hurries across for a quick single

commentary: Ellis to Sharma, no runOn a length on off stump, defended
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Jitesh Sharma, no run, back of a length on and around off-stump. punched away to cover

commentary: Ellis to Sharma, FOUR runsAnother edge, this time the outside one, but four is the result. No luck whatsoever for Ellis this over. Length ball outside off. Jitesh pushes at it and a slip would have gobbled it up
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Jitesh Sharma, FOUR, full and just outside off, Jitesh Sharma drives and the outside edge goes flying past the keeper to his right. It was bowled at 138ks and would have gone to first slip, not to be!

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runFuller-length ball outside off, he drives to the right of extra cover
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, full and just outside off, Shreyas Iyer drives and gets it to the left of deep cover

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, no runLength on and around off stump, he pushes back to the bowler
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, no run, good length on and around off, Shreyas looks to force it straight and mistimes it back to the bowler

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR runsInside-edge past the off pole, past the keeper, and goes for a four. Was a back of a length cross-seamer outside off stump. He goes for a pull and could easily have chopped it back on
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, length outside off at 132ks, Shreyas goes hard on the slog and gets a thick inside edge that races past Wade to his left

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runAnother short of a length ball outside off, eased to long on
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, short once again, Shreyas is happy to knock it to wide long-on

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma,  1 runDragged down but Jitesh can only mistime his pull to long on
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, short outside off, Jitesh Sharma jumps on the back foot and drags the pull to the right of long-on

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma,  2 runsFloated outside off, he goes inside out past extra cover and to wide long off and gets a brace
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, 2 runs, driven away to the right of sweeper cover, easy two!

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma, no runQuicker length ball outside off, he gets some bounce as well. Jitesh is beaten again
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, no run, quicker and just outside off, Jitesh Sharma looks to force it through the off-side and gets beaten on the outside edge

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma,  SIX runsSwept to Behrendorff's right at deep backward square leg, who misses the catch and what's worse tips the ball over the boundary hoarding. That was fuller and on middle and leg. Jitesh got a good piece on that, but that really should have been taken by Behrendorff
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, SIX, dropped. Jitesh Sharma went for the slogsweep. Fetched it from around leg stump and it went flying to the right of Behrendorff at deep backward square. Behrendorff was a little uncertain running across the boundary rope and ended up parrying it off his palms over the fence

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma, no runLovely ball. Tossed up outside off, Jitesh prods forward and is beaten outside off. The ball rips and beats him
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, no run, tossed full on off, Jitesh Sharma prods across and blocks it back to the bowler

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR runsOutside edge, no slip and Iyer gets another four to his name. He ain't complaining. Dwarshuis gets the length ball to angle away from the batter. He reaches for it, gets a thick outside edge
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, this one angles away from a length outside off, Shreyas gets squared up on the back foot and the outside edge (on the poke) races past the diving keeper to his right

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer,  SIX runsOh, stunning short from Shreyas. All hands. Was right in the slot outside off. Iyer leans forward and just lofts it up and over mid-off who was in
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's probably the best shot of the night so far. 129ks fuller and wider of off, Shreyas Iyer bends his back knee and lifts it over mid-off with terrific timing

commentary: Dwarshuis to Sharma,  1 runSimilar length ball outside off, he pushes towards cover and this time they go through for the run
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, short of length just outside off, Jitesh hops and taps it to the left of cover for a quick single

commentary: Dwarshuis to Sharma, no runLength just outside off, he defends close to the pitch and searches for a single only to be sent back
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jitesh Sharma, no run, good length just outside off at 136ks, punched away to the left of the bowler

commentary: Dwarshuis to Sharma, FOUR runsAnother cut, another four. Jitesh remains unperturbed. Fractionally short and wide, he styays leg side of the ball and cuts it hard past point and the balls sizzles away on this outfield
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Jitesh Sharma, FOUR, Jitesh is smoking it square on the off-side. Short and ample width outside off, Jitesh stays leg-side of the delivery and carves it behind backward point with an air of authority..

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runFuller-length ball angling away from the batter who shanks it to wide long-on
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, 134ks full and wide of off, Shreyas Iyer looks to thump it over covers and drags it off the thick toe-end to the right of mid-wicket

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma, no runFlipper outside leg stump, Jitesh goes back looking to work it to the on-side but is hurried and hit on the thigh pad
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, no run, short on leg stump, Jitesh Sharma looks to heave and gets beaten on the inside edge. Hit on the thigh pad and rolls into the leg-side...

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma, FOUR runsSlightly short and Jitesh is up and running from the get-go. He stays back and slaps it to the right of deep point who puts in a dive but can't rein it in
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, FOUR, quicker and shorter outside off, Jitesh Sharma cuts and times it well enough to beat the diving fielder at sweeper cover to his left. It was played late and went racing past backward point to his left

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma, no runWas floated around leg stump, Jitesh defends
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, no run, full on the stumps, Jitesh Sharma leans forward and blocks into the off-side

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runQuicker on middle and leg, pushed to long on
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, quicker and straighter, driven down to long-on

commentary: T Sangha to Sharma,  1 runSlower but the line is down leg, he clips it behind square
second_commentary: Sangha to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, full and fast on leg stump, Jitesh Sharma flicks it to the right of fine leg

commentary: T Sangha to Rinku Singh, OUTCatch, catch is the call and Tim David makes no mistake. Rinku departs and Sangha gets his first. That's a big wicket. Was fuller and outside off which meant Rinku had to drag it. He does not get it anywhere close to the middle of the bat and David at wide long-on completes a rather comfortable catch.Rinku Singh c David b Sangha 6 (8b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 75
second_commentary: Sangha to Rinku Singh, out Caught by Tim David!! Another one bites the dust and you could see a few disappointed faces among the crowd. Looked like a premeditated shot and it didn't come off. The length was fuller and the line, well wide of off-stump. Rinku had to fetch the slog-like-sweep and ended up skewing it off the thick inside half. Shouts of "catch it" and Tim David does well to put in a diving effort at long-on. Took it inches above the turf. Rinku Singh c Tim David b Sangha 6(8) [4s-1]

commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh,  1 runSlower back of a length ball outside off, he mistimes his cut to the right of point who dives to his right
second_commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, 1 run, short and wide of off at 118ks, Rinku stabs it to the right of backward point

commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, no runCramps Rinku for room this time around with the length ball angling on middle stump. He can only push it back towards the bowler
second_commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, no run, good length just outside off, Rinku pushes it to the left of the bowler

commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, FOUR runsChipped straight over the bowler's head. That is a top shot from Rinku. Nothing wrong with the ball. Was on a length on middle stump. He plays a control chip over and gets four to his name
second_commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, FOUR, that's much better. 134ks overpitched on the stumps, Rinku shows full face of the bat and lifts it back over the bowler's head with an air of nonchalance

commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, no runFuller-length ball outside off, he drives neatly but can't beat extra cover
second_commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, no run, full and wide of off at 135ks, Rinku belts the drive but can't get it past the sliding fielder at cover to his left

commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, no runKeeps it on a length just outside off, he pushes it to extra cover
second_commentary: Hardie to Rinku Singh, no run, on a length just outside off at 134ks, Rinku Singh taps it into the covers with soft hands

commentary: Hardie to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runOn a length on leg stump, worked to the on side for a run
second_commentary: Hardie to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, good length just outside off at 131ks, Shreyas jumps across and tucks it into the mid-wicket pocket

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runDragged down but Iyer can't take full toll. Was outside off, he can only mistime his whack to long on
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, dragged short and wide of off, Shreyas heaves the pull to the left of deep mid-wicket

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, no runOoh, loads of turn. Where did that come from? Slower on leg stump, rather outside and the ball turns a mile and catches Iyer's leading edge around off stump.
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, no run, the legbreak with a hint of extra bounce just outside off, Shreyas Iyer looks to tuck leg-side and gets a thick leading edge that drops well short of backward point

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, no runGives himself a lot of room trying to throw the bowler off his length. Sangha goes short outside off, he cuts it to point
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, no run, tad quicker and shorter outside off, Shreyas Iyer cuts and finds backward point to his right

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, no runWas a touch quicker again on the stumps, he pushes back to the bowler
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, no run, quicker on the stumps, Shreyas punches it to the right of the bowler

commentary: T Sangha to Rinku Singh,  1 runTossed up well outside off stump, Rinku prods forward and drives it all along the ground to long off
second_commentary: Sangha to Rinku Singh, 1 run, full and wide of off, Rinku Singh drives firmly to long-off

commentary: T Sangha to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runQuicker on middle and leg, he works it to long on
second_commentary: Sangha to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, full toss on the stumps, flicked away to deep mid-wicket

commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh, no runWelcomed with a quick bouncer as he ducks under
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Rinku Singh, no run, greets Rinku Singh with a pacy bumper just outside off, left alone to the keeper

commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar, OUTTaken this time and India in a spot of bother as they lose their captain. Was short of a length outside off. Surya can't quite get on top of the bounce and that means he can't keep the ball down. Cuts it straight to McDermott who takes a good low catch to his right at backward point.Suryakumar Yadav c McDermott b Dwarshuis 5 (7b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 71.42See all photos
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by McDermott!! That drop catch didn't cost much for Australia. The skipper is gone. Short and wide of off, inviting SKY to target square of the wicket on the off-side. SKY hops and looks to cut, but ends up offering a low catch to the right of McDermott at backward point. Suryakumar Yadav c McDermott b Dwarshuis 5(7)

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer,  1 runHard lengths again outside off, and a bit of miscommunication but no harm done. He bunts it to the right of point and takes off. Surya though is ball-watching before eventually going ahead.
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, short of length outside off at 134ks, Shreyas cuts to backward point and SKY was ball-watching for a while there. A bit of yes-no, yes-no but a fumble enables an easy single

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, no runGood length ball cramping Iyer for room again who can just defend it towards the off side
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, no run, good length just outside off, Shreyas Iyer jumps across and defends into the off-side

commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar,  1 runFuller again on the leg stump, he skews it off the inside half of the blade towards deep backward square leg
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, worked away behind square on the leg-side

commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar,  2 runsFuller-length ball on middle and leg, he lofts it over mid-on and once again the ball plugs on the outfield. Any other time and that ball would have sped away..
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, this is surely not a 200-plus pitch. Unless dew settles in and makes it easier for the batters, looks a bit tricky. It was full on the stumps, SKY lofts and gets it off the bottom half over mid-on. It appeared to be a boundary for a fleeting moment, but not to be

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, no runBeats him with a slower ball. Was the back of a hand stuff outside off stump. He is way too early into his pull and beaten all ends up
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, no run, slower back of a length delivery wide of off, Shreyas Iyer looks to drag it leg-side with a pull/slog and gets beaten due to lack of pace

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer,  2 runsGood length ball outside off, he stands tall and lifts it straight over the bowler's head. The ball plugs on the outfield, but enough time for the duo to collect two
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, 134ks length outside off, Shreyas Iyer lofts it back over the bowler's head and the outfield isn't quick enough to race away to the boundary

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR runsBack of a length ball on middle and leg, he stays balanced and sort of whips it past midwicket for his first four of the innings
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, 136ks length ball sits up in the outside off slot, he hops inside the crease and pulls it to the right of mid-wicket with supreme ease

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR runsBack of a length ball on middle and leg, he stays balanced and sort of whips it past midwicket for his first four of the innings
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, wide, full and drifting down leg, it was the slower ball and Shreyas ignored it to the keeper

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 wideAttempted slower ball goes awry, he sprays it down leg
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, 136ks length ball sits up in the outside off slot, he hops inside the crease and pulls it to the right of mid-wicket with supreme ease

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, 1 wideAttempted slower ball goes awry, he sprays it down leg
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, wide, full and drifting down leg, it was the slower ball and Shreyas ignored it to the keeper

commentary: Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, no runOn a length on off and middle, defended back to the bowler
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Shreyas Iyer, no run, good length just outside off, Shreyas jumps on the back foot and blocks

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar,  1 runGood length ball outside off, he opens the face of the and runs him down to deep third
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, steered away behind backward point

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, no runLength on middle and leg, defended towards mid-on
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, good length on the stumps, SKY nudges it into the leg-side

commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, no runCramps up the batter for room with the back of a length ball on middle and leg
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Shreyas Iyer, no run, good length on the stumps, SKY hops and blocks it back to the bowler

commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar,  1 runA leap and a drop. That would have been an absolute blinder had McDermott held on. Fuller and going away from Surya who skews it off the outer half of the bat. McDermott leaps up and to his right, one-handed but cannot hold on. He also has a chance at a run out at the non-striker's end but misses again
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, dropped, run-out missed? It's all happening for Australia. SKY sliced the drive to the right of McDermott at backward point. It was a tough chance, but McDermott did well to time his jump and stick his right hand out while at it. Unfortunately for Australia, the ball didn't stick and the rebound fell a bit too far out of his reach. What's more? SKY was struggling at the bowler's end and the direct hit attempt was a bit wayward as well...

commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar, no runOn a length on middle stump, Surya presents the full face of the bat back to the bowler
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, full on the stumps at 136ks, SKY drives and finds mid-on

commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, OUTTwo wickets in four balls for Australia and both openers are a goner. The ball was there to be hit. Was in the slot outside off, Gaikwad strikes it well, but just does not get the elevation. The mid-off fielder makes no mistake.Ruturaj Gaikwad c Behrendorff b Dwarshuis 10 (12b 2x4 0x6 20m) SR: 83.33See all photos
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, out Caught by Behrendorff!! Behrendorff in the action once again. Pitched fuller and in the zone outside off, Gaikwad looks to thump it straight down the ground with a solid flat-foot base, but ends up dragging it off the toe end of the bat. Catching practice (reverse cup right in front of his chest) for mid-off. Gaikwad c Behrendorff b Dwarshuis 10(12) [4s-2]

commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, no runSlower back of a length ball outside off, he taps it to backward point
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, no run, 131ks short of length outside off, Ruturaj cuts but can't get it past the fielder at backward point

commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, no runFuller outside off, drives to extra cover
second_commentary: Dwarshuis to Gaikwad, no run, 135ks full outside off, Ruturaj drives and picks out the fielder at cover to his left

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, OUTThat's gone high, very high and Ellis takes a really good catch running on from deep square leg. That was an absolute steepler. Pacy back of a length ball on middle. Jaiswal once again goes for a pull, gets a massive top-edge and Ellis grabs it reverse-cupped.Yashasvi Jaiswal c Ellis b Behrendorff 21 (15b 1x4 2x6 17m) SR: 140
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, out Caught by Nathan Ellis!! And, would you believe, it is the short ball that gets him. Behrendorff did well to deny room and angle it into the body, thick top-edge on the pull and Ellis steadies himself running in to his right from deep square. It hung in the air for an eternity and wasn't really easy with all the noise around. A much-needed break for Australia, nonetheless. Jaiswal c Nathan Ellis b Behrendorff 21(15) [4s-1 6s-2]

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, FOUR runsHasn't timed it but will clear mid-off easily. Was a fuller-length ball on and around off, Jasiwal goes up and over and even though gets it off the toe end of the bat, he gets four to his name
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, FOUR, Behrendorff tries the knuckle ball but the length was a touch too full just outside off, Yashasvi lofts and skews it off the cue end over mid-on. It drops tantalizingly short of the fence and trickles away ever so slowly...

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal,  SIX runsOUT OF THE SCREWS! He was camped on the backfoot waiting for the short ball. The bowler goes short and Jaiswal absolutely wallops him over the deep midwicket fence
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, SIX, rule number one when bowling to Yashasvi Jaiswal: Never bowl short at 130ks. Had enough width outside off and it's been powered for a mighty maximum over mid-wicket. Almost 90 metres...

commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, 1 leg byeWas there some glove there? Terrific effort regardless by Wade. Nope off the pad. Back of a length ball on middle and leg. Gaikwad gets inside the line and looks to help it past the keeper. Can't beat a flying Wade.
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, leg byes, 1 run, 129ks short of length angling down leg, Ruturaj looks to slog and gets beaten. Takes the thigh pad/hip and travels to the left of Wade. A half-stop results in a single...

commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, FOUR runsGaikwad goes big now. Was on a length on middle and leg, Gaikwad gets across and heaves it over midwicket. Gets it off the inside half of the bat and gets his first four
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, FOUR, 135ks fuller on the stumps, Ruturaj opts for a heave and manages to get it off the thick inside half over mid-wicket. Enough power to get it racing to the fence...

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal,  1 runShort and wide, he stands tall and cuts it away hard but straight to deep point
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, 1 run, 131ks short and wide of off, Yashasvi cuts fiercely but picks out the fielder at deep backward point to his right

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal,  1 runShort of a good length and hurries Jaiswal as the ball gets big on him and he can only biff it to deep square leg
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, 1 run, this 140ks short ball gets big on Yashasvi, and therefore, he mistimes the pull to the left of deep square leg

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no runAnother swing and a miss. Hardie stays back of a length just outside off. Jaiswal dances down the track, staying leg side of the ball and looks for a repeat of the previous shot. Only connects at thin air
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no run, jumps down the track and gets beaten by the slower delivery just outside off. It was slow and short from Aaron Hardie and Yashasvi perhaps expected the length to be fuller, not to be...

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal,  SIX runsConnects this time and how! Similar back of a length ball outside off, this time he gets across and in position nice and early. Sends it soaring it over the deep midwicket fence.
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, SIX, that's gone to Mysuru. Right in the slot for Yashasvi, it sits up on a short length just outside off and he's sent the pull packing for an 87-metre maximum over mid-wicket

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no runSwing and a miss! Back of a length ball angling away from the batter, who loses patience and tries to whack the ball to Cubbon Park. Makes no connection.
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no run, short of length angling away outside off, Yashasvi looks to heave leg-side and gets beaten on the outside edge

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no runNo boundaries yet. Length with the angle going across Jaiswal who taps it to short third
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, no run, hint of width on this length delivery outside off, Yashasvi cuts late but can't get it past short third to his left

commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad,  1 runOn a length around off stump, he pushes towards cover with soft hands and sets off for a quick run
second_commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, 1 run, 134ks good length on off, Ruturaj taps it in front of cover and hustles across for a quick single

commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad,  1 runGood length ball outside off with a bit of shape away. He bunts it to the right of extra cover for a run
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Gaikwad, 1 run, 134ks good length just outside off, Ruturaj opens the bat face and punches to the left of cover for a quick single

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, 1 leg byeHurries him with that length ball on middle and leg. He looks to flay it away to the on-side, the ball catches his pads through to the on-side.
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, leg byes, 1 run, 131ks back of a length angling down leg, Yashasvi swivels and fails to get bat on the attempted whip/hook. Gets it off the thigh pad wide of backward square leg for a quick single

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no runAgain, excellent length on middle stump, pushed to mid-on
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no run, full on the stumps, Yashasvi gets across and blocks to the right of mid-wicket

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal,  2 runsUp and over, just! Was on a length with a hint of shape away from Jaiswal. He lines up to go over mid-off, does not time it well enough. Just about clears the in-field
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, 2 runs, full and just outside off at 127ks, Yashasvi looks for an airy-fairy drive but chips it off the thick inside half over cover. Good enough to pick up a couple of runs...

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no runFuller outside off, mistimed to mid-off
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no run, pitched up just outside off at 130ks, Yashasvi toe-ends the drive to the left of mid-off

commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no runCuts him in half first up. Lovely ball to start off. Gets the ball on a length and with his height, he'll always find bounce. Jaiswal is cramped for room as he looks to cut, the ball catches his pad through to the stumps
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Jaiswal, no run, short of length angles in late just outside off, Yashasvi looks to cut but there was no room on offer. Past the inside edge and doesn't miss the off-stump by much

commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, FOUR runsSHOT! Length ball shaping away and this time Gaikwad is right on point with his foot movement. Strides forward and drives on the up to the right of mid-off.
second_commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, FOUR, that is music to the ears - hitting the middle of middle. 134ks fraction fuller outside off, Ruturaj pings the drive in the gap between cover and mid-off and gets off the mark with a boundary

commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no runPlay and a miss! Length ball tailing away from Gaikwad, who does not get forward enough and just about searches for the ball with his hands. Misses
second_commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no run, the outswinger from Aaron Hardie. Hits the fullish length and gets the ball to wobble away in the channel, lures Ruturaj into a loose punch/drive and beats the outside edge

commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no runOn a length with a hint of movement around middle stump, ticked towards mid-on
second_commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no run, good length angled in towards middle and leg, Ruturaj flicks timidly and picks mid-wicket

commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no runOn a length on off stump. Defended back to the bowler.
second_commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no run, full and shaping in towards off at 136ks, punched firmly back to the bowler

commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no runAgain, a hint of shape away from the batter, who prods forward and drives to cover
second_commentary: Hardie to Gaikwad, no run, pitched up outside off at 133ks, Ruturaj drives and finds cover to his left

commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal,  1 runLength with a hint of shape into the batter, who pushes towards cover and sets off
second_commentary: Hardie to Jaiswal, 1 run, good length curving in late just outside off, Jaiswal taps it under his eyes and hares across for a quick single
